instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.A1932: What is A1932? A1932 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2018, 2019 with EMC 3184, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01521..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage, after new battery 5v no power
threads.message:
Someone came in with an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> which had a liquid spill which wasn't noticed until an hour later. Audio board, fan and battery were liquid damaged but the mainboard seemed fine. Tried to start up using only mainboard and screen which made for a very slow MacBook.
Replaced battery and connected trackpad/keyboard flex and worked nice and smoothly again.
Cleaned the rest and connected one by one, but after the audio board flex the laptop does not give 20v anymore
Removing this flex now doesn't change the situation. Its on 5v even with only adapter connected.
Checked voltages around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>: no <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL>
Checked around <CHIP>ISL95828</CHIP>: VCC no voltage, VIN 12.15 and jumping shortly to 11V every 3 seconds
Is this the symptom of a faulty fried ISL, or can the jumping be a symptom of the CPU trying to boot when there is 5v and no 20v?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage, after new battery 5v no power
threads.message: Just noticed there is no enable on pin 48 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, am looking into that right now

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage, after new battery 5v no power
threads.message: <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> also missing, could be due to T2 issues DFU or...? Not sure what lead to follow nor can I find any logical next steps when looking at the schematic (googling around for answers right now)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage, after new battery 5v no power
threads.message:
Did you replace audio board/flex?
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1932</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/2179 both suffer because of audio board corrosion.
Many times T2 gets damaged its data lines from J6100.

Check diode mode to ground at T2 lines on J6100.
Pay atention to pins 32 & 33; next to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage, after new battery 5v no power
threads.message: pin 22 is value between 4 and 20, and pin 33 is a solid 0

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage, after new battery 5v no power
threads.message:
I don't know how to interpret these values.
Usually, we post diode mode readings like 0.xxx.

BTW, check w/ and w/o audio flex/board connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage, after new battery 5v no power
threads.message:
Measured again and I think it equates to this:
pin 33: 0.004 (actually not 0.000)
pin 22: 0.004

with board/flex connected
pin 33: 0.004
pin 22: 0.004

This probably means that the easiest way for the current to go to ground is through the motherboard meaning the T2? As the audioboard doesn't change anything

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage, after new battery 5v no power
threads.message:
Yeah, classic failure on these boards; leakage from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to mentioned T2 lines.
Audio board corrosion is very dangerous...
